A righteous child is the more beautiful of the two recollections
A child is one of the two enemies
The severest of hardships is [having] evil offspring

Wisdom: خَيْرُ مَا وَرَّثَ الْآبَاءُ الْأَبْنَاءَ الْأَدَبُ
enWisdom: The best thing that parents can bequeath to their children is good etiquette

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ مِنْ أَعْظَمِ الْبَلَاءِ كَثْرَةُ الْعَائِلَةِ وَغَلَبَةُ الدَّيْنِ وَدَوَامُ الْمَرَضِ
enWisdom: Three things are from the greatest tribulations: a very large family, an overwhelming loan and unrelenting sickness
The worst of all children is the undutiful one
The loss of a child burns the heart

Wisdom: عَظَّمَ اللَّهُ أَجْرَكَ فِيمَا أَبَادَ وَبَارَكَ لَكَ فِيمَا أَفَادَ
enWisdom: He (‘a) consoled a man whose son passed away and [at the same time] was blessed with the birth of [another] son saying: May Allah make your reward great [for your patience] in that which He took away, and may His blessings be with you in that which He has bestowed [upon you]

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَنْكَفَ مِنْ أَبَوَيْهِ فَقَدْ خَالَفَ الرُّشْدَ
enWisdom: NULL
Disregarding the rights [of your parents] is from [the acts of] filial impiety
The death of a child is [like a] tear in the heart
The undutiful child is a tribulation and a misfortune

Wisdom: وَلَدُ السَّوْءِ يَهْدِمُ الشَّرَفَ وَيَشِينُ السَّلَفَ
enWisdom: An evil child destroys one’s honour and disgraces one’s ancestors

Wisdom: وَلَدُ السَّوْءِ يَعَرُّ [يعز] السَّلَفَ وَيُفْسِدُ الْخَلَفَ
enWisdom: An evil child dishonours one’s ancestors and corrupts one’s descendants

No community has established brotherhood for other than seeking the pleasure of Allah, the Glorified, but that their brotherhood will be counted as a sin against them on the day when the deeds are presented to Allah, the Glorified
